member.name: M:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Helper.NextPowerOfTwo(System.UInt32)
member.summary: "Next Largest Power of 2 Given a binary integer value x, the next largest power of 2 can be computed by a SWAR algorithm that recursively "folds" the upper bits into the lower bits. This process yields a bit vector with the same most significant 1 as x, but all 1's below it. Adding 1 to that value yields the next largest power of 2. For a 32-bit value:"

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Helper.IsPowerOfTwo(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Describes whether is power of two

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Helper.Mul(Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Matrix22,Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Vector2)
member.summary: Multiply a matrix times a vector. If a rotation matrix is provided, then this transforms the vector from one frame to another.

member.summary: Multiply a matrix transpose times a vector. If a rotation matrix is provided, then this transforms the vector from one frame to another (inverse transform).

member.summary: Multiply a matrix times a vector.

member.summary: Atans the 2 using the specified y

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Matrix22
member.summary: A 2-by-2 matrix. Stored in column-major order.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Matrix22.#ctor(System.Single)
member.summary: Construct this matrix using an angle. This matrix becomes an orthonormal rotation matrix.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Matrix22.Set(System.Single)
member.summary: Initialize this matrix using an angle. This matrix becomes an orthonormal rotation matrix.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Matrix22.SetIdentity
member.summary: Set this to the identity matrix.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Matrix22.SetZero
member.summary: Set this matrix to all zeros.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Matrix22.GetAngle
member.summary: Extract the angle from this matrix (assumed to be a rotation matrix).

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Matrix22.GetInverse
member.summary: Compute the inverse of this matrix, such that inv(A) * A = identity.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Matrix22.Solve(Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Vector2)
member.summary: Solve A * x = b, where b is a column vector. This is more efficient than computing the inverse in one-shot cases.

member.name: P:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Matrix22.Identity
member.summary: Gets the value of the identity

member.name: T:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Matrix33
member.summary: A 3-by-3 matrix. Stored in column-major order.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Matrix33.SetZero
member.summary: Set this matrix to all zeros.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Matrix33.Solve33(Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Vector3)
member.summary: Solve A * x = b, where b is a column vector. This is more efficient than computing the inverse in one-shot cases.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Matrix33.Solve22(Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Vector2)
member.summary: Solve A * x = b, where b is a column vector. This is more efficient than computing the inverse in one-shot cases. Solve only the upper 2-by-2 matrix equation.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Settings.FORCE_SCALE(System.Single)
member.summary: Forces the scale using the specified x

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Settings.FORCE_INV_SCALE(System.Single)
member.summary: Forces the inv scale using the specified x

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Settings.LinearSlop
member.summary: A small length used as a collision and constraint tolerance. Usually it is chosen to be numerically significant, but visually insignificant.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Settings.AngularSlop
member.summary: A small angle used as a collision and constraint tolerance. Usually it is chosen to be numerically significant, but visually insignificant.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Settings.PolygonRadius
member.summary: The radius of the polygon/edge shape skin. This should not be modified. Making this smaller means polygons will have and insufficient for continuous collision. Making it larger may create artifacts for vertex collision.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Settings.ToiSlop
member.summary: Continuous collision detection (CCD) works with core, shrunken shapes. This is amount by which shapes are automatically shrunk to work with CCD. This must be larger than LinearSlop.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Settings.MaxToiContactsPerIsland
member.summary: Maximum number of contacts to be handled to solve a TOI island.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Settings.MaxToiJointsPerIsland
member.summary: Maximum number of joints to be handled to solve a TOI island.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Settings.VelocityThreshold
member.summary: A velocity threshold for elastic collisions. Any collision with a relative linear velocity below this threshold will be treated as inelastic.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Settings.MaxLinearCorrection
member.summary: The maximum linear position correction used when solving constraints. This helps to prevent overshoot.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Settings.MaxAngularCorrection
member.summary: The maximum angular position correction used when solving constraints. This helps to prevent overshoot.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Settings.MaxLinearVelocity
member.summary: The maximum linear velocity of a body. This limit is very large and is used to prevent numerical problems. You shouldn't need to adjust this.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Settings.MaxAngularVelocity
member.summary: The maximum angular velocity of a body. This limit is very large and is used to prevent numerical problems. You shouldn't need to adjust this.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Settings.MaxTranslation
member.summary: The maximum linear velocity of a body. This limit is very large and is used to prevent numerical problems. You shouldn't need to adjust this.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Settings.MaxRotation
member.summary: The maximum angular velocity of a body. This limit is very large and is used to prevent numerical problems. You shouldn't need to adjust this.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Settings.ContactBaumgarte
member.summary: This scale factor controls how fast overlap is resolved. Ideally this would be 1 so that overlap is removed in one time step. However using values close to 1 often lead to overshoot.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Settings.TimeToSleep
member.summary: The time that a body must be still before it will go to sleep.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Settings.LinearSleepTolerance
member.summary: A body cannot sleep if its linear velocity is above this tolerance.

member.name: F:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Settings.AngularSleepTolerance
member.summary: A body cannot sleep if its angular velocity is above this tolerance.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Settings.MixFriction(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Friction mixing law. Feel free to customize this.

member.name: M:Alis.Core.Aspect.Math.Settings.MixRestitution(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Restitution mixing law. Feel free to customize this.

member.summary: Get the interpolated transform at a specific time.
member.param: Alpha is a factor in [0,1], where 0 indicates t0.

member.summary: Advance the sweep forward, yielding a new initial state.
